definition: speaking and singing, as in various forms of storytelling such as 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2] and 相聲|相声[xiang4 sheng5]/(music) rapping
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: They said Ican't rap about bein?broke no more.
sentences.chinese: 她们说我没有办法再对于旁人弹词说唱了。

sentences.english: The contents in the Shibis' talking and singing are epics of the historical development of the Qiang people.
sentences.chinese: 释比说唱的内容就是一部部羌民族历史发展的史诗。

sentences.english: He can't sing a song well, let alone Beijing Opera.
sentences.chinese: 他连一首歌曲都唱不好，更不用说唱京戏了。

sentences.english: A "celebrated" Tunisian rapper supports Shariah law.
sentences.chinese: 一个“有名的”突尼斯说唱歌手支持伊斯兰教法。

sentences.english: I rap for listeners, blunt heads, fly ladies and prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 我为聆听者，大麻叶而说唱，也能让女士，囚徒。

sentences.english: Black people are world renowned rappers, basketball players and break dancers.
sentences.chinese: 黑人是国际知名的说唱歌手，篮球运动员和霹雳舞者。

sentences.english: LL became the first rap artist to have 6 consecutive million-selling LPs.
sentences.chinese: LL成为了第一个连续售出6百万张唱片的说唱歌手。

sentences.english: I'm not very keen on Rap.
His first official rap record was "6 in the Mornin'".
sentences.chinese: 在早上，他的第一次正式说唱记录6。

sentences.english: The baggy style is typical for American rappers.
sentences.chinese: 宽松的牛仔裤是美国说唱歌手典型的风格。

sentences.english: The kind of rap Tupac used was revolutionary.
sentences.chinese: 图帕克的一种说唱用的是革命性的。

sentences.english: She lead the sang rap artist song, sing along with, all public anger.
sentences.chinese: 她带头唱起了说唱艺人编的歌，众人跟唱，群情激愤。

sentences.english: I like hip-hop dance and I once won a first prize in a competition.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢说唱舞蹈，且曾经在比赛中获得一等奖。

sentences.english: At the age of 12 Gin Oy first heard the rapper L.
sentences.chinese: 欧阳靖12岁第一次听到黑人说唱歌手L。

sentences.english: You are not just watching a cable bio about a zillionaire rap mogul.
sentences.chinese: 你不只是看一个电缆约是亿万富翁说唱大亨生物。

definition: talkative/to blather/to shoot one's mouth off/rap (genre of music)
sung performance/to sing for an audience
